question:
The graph below shows the number of enquiries received by the Tourist Information Office in one city over a six-month period in 2011.

Summarize the information by selecting and reporting the main features and make comparisons where relevant.

You should write at least 150 words.
text: Over half of a year period in 2011 witnessed the change in the figures of queries collected by the Tourist Information Office.
Overall, the quantity of questions proposed in person and by telecommunication had an upward tendency while the exchanges through letter and electrical mail expressing a contrary movement.

Steadily increasing is the trend of the data of inquiries which were demanded in the three initial months in 2011, starting at approximately 400 and ending with 1200. 900 to 800 was the slight decline of the inquiries put forward by phone in the first month. In February, it showed a moderate increase from 800 to 100 and remained stable for the next month. As for contacts by email or letter, it leveled off in the two very primary months at roughly 700 and then demonstrated a minimal decrease from 700 to below 600.

A substantial rise, which was illustrated by the number of people coming to resolve their questions started at 1200 and reached a peak of 1900. Identically, the line expressed the number of inquiries brought out by telecoms significantly climbed up from 1000 and ended with the highest point at precisely 1600. Gradually decreasing was still the tendency of the number of questioning letters and electrical mail in April. Until May, it remained stable at below 400, which was the lowest point of this line.
